post_text: I have seen it suggested on a national stage that teachers need to go back to work, like other essential workers. I think we all agree teachers are essential. But, I know from first hand experience that our educators haven't stopped working. There is more to teaching than what happens in the classroom. Their hours of work and preparation laid a foundation for two great, sometimes bumpy, first days. I want to say thank you to our Bobcat community for the support you have shown as we got ready for school to resume. It's been stressful and scary for everyone. But your understanding, your consideration for MCS staff and student safety, your kindness, has made it possible for us to KEEP working. I am grateful to the staff, the families, and the students for your continued dedication to moving forward together as a community. Thank you, from the depths of my Bobcat heart, thank you. -Mrs. Tario

Senior 2020 feature: Jaden Romero
"I am Jaden Romero, a Senior at McCurdy. I danced with NDI for 7 years. I had the most fun participating with the Buddy Program through Project Carino where I mentored elementary students. I was part of the student court my Junior year.
I will begin my college career at UNM-LA to complete my basics and receive an associates degree in Psychology. Once I am done with my basics, I will transfer to UNM main campus to begin my psychology degree with a minor in Sign Language Interpretation. I haven’t determined what branch of psychology to pursue. My plans after college are to return to the valley to give back to my community in any way I can.
I am still at a loss for words. This is not how I expected my senior year to finish. But, through this pandemic, I will keep my faith in God and stay positive knowing that my class will change the world. Soon, we will be together to celebrate our accomplishments. Thank you to the McCurdy community for giving me the best high school experience I could ask for." - Jaden
